reviews.review_msg: Incredible professor. He is so caring and even learns the names of all of his students. His lectures are heavy on material but he makes sure to make everyone review everything by having multiple quizzes. He is so passionate about the material so he is a very good lecturer. He is very fair. Loved his class and his teachings so much.

Mike is one of the best and most knowledgable biology profs in the department. He always gives very thoughtful answers to questions, isn't afraid to say when he doesn't know something, and makes you want to learn about the material regardless of the grade. Highly recommend to take a class with him+ ultra nice (final questions from quizzes)

Mike is an incredible professor. Lectures are a bit heavy, and you have to take a lot of notes, but he does post all the videos, so you can catch up on what you missed. His syllabus is well-organized, and he is very knowledgeable, caring, and easy to approach. exams are a bit tricky, but the interesting topics make up for it. Recommend his class.

Mike is an extremely knowledgable biologist. His lectures are very dense, and it can be hard to follow along if you space out for even a minute. But he really cares about his students. If you ask him questions over email or in person, he will give you thoughtful answers. The quizzes are very hard and rely on your ability to memorize things.

I'm not sure why Mike gets all this hate, I honestly loved him as a professor! While his lectures are extremely knowledge dense, he is super kind and caring and is happy to explain concepts you don't understand again. The quizzes are difficult, but nothing felt out of the realm of an upper BISC course and he drops your lowest score!

Mike is a sweetheart but the content is crazy. So much to memorize, quizzes ask the most niche questions so you have to study all the material. TA was a blessing and the field trip was a highlight for sure. Just be prepared to study a lot, and write LOTS of notes in class as theres nothing on his slides Sucked that lab was so ahead of the lecture

Amazing prof!  His course material is very dense but he shows genuine interest in the material and cares for students.  Lots of material to cover which is a fault of the course and not him, he does a great job of making it interesting and digestible.

Great Prof. Really helpful outside of the class. You have to take a lot of notes, and the quizzes are not easy. But gives a lot of bonus marks and is an easy marker.  Textbook not mandatory. Recommended.

Mike is a great prof but his quizzes are extremely insane, I studied like crazy and could barely pass it. It expected you to memorize the most smallest details. Lecture is very content heavy and slides only have pictures. He doesn't stress on what he will test on, so you are practically judging whats important yourself. Goodluck!
Lectures are insanely uninformative as you are required to pay attention to every single detail he mentions and the slides he provides are basically useless (better off with the textbook).

I'm not sure why Mike's reviews are so low. Mike is a super kind professor that is passionate about what he does. While the format of his lectures could be improved upon (his slides are just images, leaving lots of writing to be done in lectures), his exams are relevant to the course material and doable if you study it like any other biology class

Mike is a very passionate and kind lecturer, he really loves sharing his knowledge and his boomer jokes are funny & well-timed. The tests are quite difficult, but as someone who never studied for the tests and barely-to-never read the textbook I definitely passed and still enjoyed the course. Do try to attend the lectures and read the textbook tho

Mike is great at explaining things and super passionate. However, he covers WAY too many details and obscure groups, and the lectures are too heavy for the course to be enjoyable. Tests are quite difficult, and the course requires an obscene amount of studying and memorizing super niche details - a more focused approach could be beneficial.

Mike is a nice guy but he is not a good lecturer. His lectures are long and meandering and he will easily put you to sleep. His slides are just images so you have to take thorough notes, which is hard because you have no idea what is important. Tests are hard because you don't know what to study and he doesn't emphasize what he tests on.

I started the course with a positive-neutral mindset, and ended up hating the lec portion because of how hard to follow his lectures are. Lecture slides are just a bunch of diagrams, his material can be phylogeny-heavy, and there's so much material examinable for one quiz (total of 4). My experience in short: crammed my brain with difficult names.

His lectures are extremely hard to follow – he speaks slowly and pauses between words frequently. All lectures slides are essentially diagrams. Very grateful for the recorded lectures, but be prepared to spend lots of time reading the textbook.

He is really nice but not great at teaching. His lecture slides only contain figures with little to no texts so you basically have to note down everything he says without knowing which points are important or not. Some of the materials are a bit interesting but there is A LOT to memorize so it's definitely not an easy course.

Good prof, had a good experience with him in bisc 202 , explains lectures well and uploads pre-lecture videos for extra help. Does in class i clicker questions, midterms are frequent but fair. Overall a good class and a good prof. You just need to put in the time to look over all lecture slides.

Mike is a really nice guy but not very good at teaching. This is a difficult course and he doesn't explain the concepts well enough. He gives 4 short midterms (usually out of 20) and a final exam which was out of 52, so if you want to get a high grade you can't lose many marks on the exams. The textbook was not helpful, just buy the access code.

Mike is an OK prof, super nice, tutorials were not helpful. Read textbook ahead and make sure you understand all concepts before class. Tests were short, so its somewhat hard to demonstrate understanding in all concepts. Not sure if Id recommend him but also not sure if I wouldn't. Some memorization, mostly practice, weekly quizzes and assignments.

Mike is a nice guy in general but he shouldnt be a lecturer. Not for this class at least. Went to class to get iClicker participation marks, not to learn. YouTube taught me 90% of the course material. I also had to buy a $120 textbook that was not useful as it was way too detailed for the course, but you NEED the access code that comes with it��

Hart is a sweet human being, but his notes and lectures are so vague while his exams are incredibly precise. They're also only out of 20, so if you mess up even one question you lose a whole letter grade. There's no clear distinction of what you should really know for exams but they still have high expectations.

Tutorials sucked, my TA was mean even though I participated regularly, never skipped, and knew most of the material. The T/F questions are worth 4/20 on the exam and theres only 2 so be careful! Dont take this class with him or Kevin, they teach the course the same way. Very picky marker, gave me 0 on a question out of 2 bc I forgot to add 1 word

Mike is good at explaining concepts. In order to do well, it's important to come to class prepared and understand concepts. Exams are a bit low on points, so if you miss one question your grade goes down by a bit. Always accessible for extra help.

Michael Hart isn't a good prof at all. His lectures aren't his own, and he doesn't put in any effort to make himself a good teacher. His exams are hard and he's very picky about his answers. The level of difficulty on exams also don't match up with the level of difficulty in the lecture/tutorial/online questions.

I typically perform above average in biology but he rushes too much in class and exams are too short, hes a very picky marker, does not even give out half marks. Exams are usually out of 20 and most questions are worth at least 5 marks. I think I might have to redo this class :(. Please avoid him. Hes super nice but not worth lowering your gpa.
Tough tests, good lectures.

Clicker questions in class, textbook readings are not tested on, no answers posted for practice questions, only had one job - to read the lecture slides, didn't even finish that 90% of the time, you have to finish it on your own or he posts post lecture videos where he finishes his reading, tutorial quizzes were super tough

Mike is a nice guy but his teaching is awful. When you ask him a question to clarify something, he doesn't give you a direct answer. He just talks about the theory behind the answer which could cause more confusion. Also, how exam questions are worth so little 1-3 point per question even if it's a long calculation question that could've worth more

BISC202 is a tough course. MUCH harder than the regular biology class because there is zero memorization and lots of problem solving. Mike doesn't make this course any easier. His midterms start late and end early. We had only 35 minutes to write. Problem sets are also much harder that concepts taught in class. Very nice guy though.
if you did the practice questions and went through the lecture slide iclickers, the final was probably very easy for you. absolute legend of a prof

Nice guy, but not a good teacher. Didn't even write his own lecture notes. Has a tendency to ramble on about insignificant details, but misses big ideas in his overly-busy lecture slides. Kind of assumes that you learn this stuff through osmosis. AVOID, especially if not a BISC major. Hard course in general, but could be taught better.

Mike seems like a cool guy but BISC 202 was terrible with him. I was pretty excited to learn about genetics and was willing to put the work in but I was left clueless after every lecture. The problem sets do not resemble what he teaches in class. No answers available for practice questions.. some quizzes were decent while others were HARD(low avg)

Uses clickers. Pre-Lecture videos help to understand concepts. Textbook readings definitely not mandatory for exams. Be prepared for quizzes in tutorials and weekly questions. Clickers and questions are for participation only. Midterms are extremely time constrained. Otherwise, the material isn't super difficult to pick up. Interesting lectures.

He is very detail oriented and expects you to know your stuff. A lot of phylogeny-based questions on the final exam. Make sure you read the textbook thoroughly and keep up with lecture notes. Ask for help clarification or help whenever possible, he is willing to do research to help you out.

so much info in burns your brain. definately knows his stuff, too bad that his taxonomy was completely different from the textbook. if you can really focus in class and catch everythign you'll be fine, otherwise prepare yourself for many quality hours with the text.

You'd be hard-pressed to find a prof who loves his work as much as Mike does. While he certainly didn't make this class easy, he did give us fair warning at the start of the semester that it required lots of work. His lectures were fun and inspiring, every single time. It also helped that he chose great TA's. Mike Hart rocks!

Nice, genuine guy.  Class notes are just pictures/diagrams and you must write down own notes while he talks.  Midterm and final exam tricky; not much writing, lot's of 1-couple word answers.  Lots of nit-picky details to remember.
59% average on midterm :( way too much material on one midterm

His textbook is an encyclopedia. Do NOT bother reading it. It will take you years upon years upon years. Therefore LECTURE MATERIAL, LECTURE MATERIAL, LECTURE MATERIAL. Some chapters are 100 pages. And each chapter corresponds to a single lecture.
15 chapters on the midterm!!!!!! not so much hard just way too much info at once
